alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 10:00AM CST until January 29 at 8:20AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 27.0 feet. - The bankfull stage is 13.00 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Sunday was 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 05/30/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 27.0 Sun 9 am CST 11.0 4.9 4.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening. late tonight at 400 AM CST.
